hero.title: KBG - Kamand Bioengineering Group
hero.subtitle: An interdisciplinary student club at IIT Mandi exploring the frontiers of biology, engineering, and technology.
hero.description: From synthetic biodesigns to AI-driven bio-models, we blend biology with computation, hardware, and creative engineering. Join us to build projects, attend workshops, and apply various engineering concepts with a biological twist.

highlights.title: Active projects
highlights.text: From biosensing systems and cellular automata to bio-AI models, all developed by interdisciplinary teams.

highlights.title: Events hosted
highlights.text: Hands-on workshops, technical talks, design challenges, and hackathons bridging biology with computing and engineering.

highlights.title: Lab Access
highlights.text: Access to IIT Mandi research labs for real experimentation

sections.title: Why KBG
sections.copy: Biotechnology, data science, and engineering are converging faster than ever before. KBG empowers students to work at this intersection — where circuits meet cells, and algorithms meet ecosystems. Through events and projects, we aim to have fun while exploring new topics.

sections.title: What we do
sections.copy: We do projects that combine biology with several engineering disciplines. We host workshops, talks, and hackathons to explore emerging topics at this intersection.

sections.title: What we have done
sections.copy: Since our inception in 2020, KBG has successfully organized multiple workshops, talks, and hackathons. Our members have even represented IIT Mandi at iGEM. Following that legacy, we continue to spread knowledge about this field through our events and projects.

tracks.title: AI × Biology
tracks.summary: Leverage data-driven models to interpret biological patterns and simulate life-inspired systems.
focus: Neural Cellular Automata and generative bio-simulations

tracks.title: Synthetic Biology & Biodesign
tracks.summary: Design and construct new biological parts, devices, and systems, or to redesign existing ones for useful purposes
focus: Participation in iGEM and other biodesign competitions

tracks.title: Bio Instrumentation
tracks.summary: Build hardware systems that interface with biological entities for monitoring, analysis, or intervention.
focus: Analysis of biosignals using embedded systems

stories.quote: CRISPR gene editing now corrects sickle cell disease in living patients. We're literally rewriting genetic code to cure diseases once thought permanent.
Lab-grown neurons learned to play Pong in 5 minutes. Biological cells outperformed AI at learning—brain-computer hybrids are here.
Bacteria navigate using Earth's magnetic field with built-in compasses. Engineers are now embedding similar bio-magnetic sensors in medical nanorobots.

contact.headline: Let’s stimulate some neurons together!
